Exaggeration: The claim exaggerates the number of Broward County Commissioners arrested by stating that three were arrested, when in reality only one was arrested.
Lack of enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that the commissioners accepted millions of dollars in trade for illegal favors.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the arrests of the commissioners mentioned in the expert's verdict are the same ones referred to in the claim, without providing clear evidence or connection.
Contradiction of fact: The claim contradicts the fact that only one commissioner was arrested, while the claim states that three were arrested.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not accurately representing the actual arrests and circumstances described by the expert.
